disclaimer: This is informational only and does not constitute legal advice. Court procedures may vary by county.
timingNote: Mississippi has FASTER eviction timelines than many states - 3-day notice for non-payment requires immediate action

steps.name: Notice Period
steps.description: Landlord must serve proper written notice to tenant

steps.name: File Unlawful Detainer
steps.description: Landlord files unlawful detainer with Justice or County Court

steps.name: Service of Summons
steps.description: Court serves summons and complaint on tenant

steps.name: Court Hearing
steps.description: Judge hears case; both parties present evidence

steps.name: Judgment
steps.description: Court rules for landlord or tenant

steps.name: Appeal Period
steps.description: Losing party has 5 days to appeal

steps.name: Writ of Possession
steps.description: If no appeal, writ issued to sheriff or constable

steps.name: Physical Eviction
steps.description: Sheriff or constable executes writ and removes tenant

fastTimelineWarning.title: FAST TIMELINE WARNING
fastTimelineWarning.description: Mississippi evictions move faster than most states
criticalPoints: Only 3 days to pay rent or vacate after notice
Only 5 days to appeal after judgment
Physical eviction can happen within 24-48 hours of writ

defenseOptions.name: Improper Notice
defenseOptions.description: Challenge the adequacy or service of the 3-day notice
checklist: Did notice state amount of rent due?
Was full 3-day period given before filing?
Does notice demand payment or possession?

defenseOptions.name: Payment Made Within 3-Day Period
defenseOptions.description: All rent was paid within the 3-day notice period
checklist: Was full amount of rent claimed paid?
defenseOptions.urgentNote: ACT FAST - only 3 days to pay

defenseOptions.name: Breach of Warranty of Habitability
defenseOptions.description: Property has serious conditions affecting habitability
checklist: Are there serious conditions affecting health/safety?
Did you notify landlord of conditions in writing?
Did landlord fail to make repairs within 14 days?
defenseOptions.caveat: May reduce rent owed; must have given landlord 14-day notice to repair

defenseOptions.name: Improper Charges Included
defenseOptions.description: Amount claimed includes fees or charges not authorized by lease
checklist: Are there charges not in lease?

defenseOptions.name: Retaliatory Eviction
defenseOptions.description: Eviction filed in response to tenant exercising legal rights
checklist: Did you recently complain about conditions?
Was eviction filed within 6 months of protected activity?

defenseOptions.name: Security Deposit Violation
defenseOptions.description: Landlord failed to properly handle security deposit
checklist: Did landlord fail to return deposit within 45 days?

defenseOptions.name: Violation Cured
documentation: Written notice to landlord of cure

defenseOptions.name: No Actual Violation
defenseOptions.description: Alleged conduct does not violate lease terms
checklist: What specific lease provision is cited?
Does your conduct actually violate that provision?
Is the lease provision clear and enforceable?

defenseOptions.name: Selective Enforcement
defenseOptions.description: Landlord enforces provision against you but not others
checklist: Are other tenants violating same provision?
Has landlord taken action against them?

defenseOptions.name: Landlord Breached First
defenseOptions.description: Landlord's prior breach may excuse tenant's conduct
checklist: Did you give landlord notice of breach?

defenseOptions.name: Improper Termination Notice
checklist: Was notice for full rental period?

defenseOptions.name: New Tenancy Created
checklist: Did landlord accept rent after lease end?

critical.action: Pay rent immediately or prepare to defend
Note court date; prepare response; gather evidence
MUST appear or risk default judgment
File appeal immediately if grounds exist

justiceCourt.name: Justice Court
procedures: No jury trial in Justice Court

filingAnswer.description: Tenant may file written answer before hearing

countyCourt.name: County Court
countyCourt.description: Higher court option in some counties
procedures: De novo appeal to Circuit Court

appeal.name: Notice of Appeal
requirements: File in court where judgment was entered

jackson.name: Jackson/Hinds County Notes
notes: Hinds County Court and Justice Court both handle evictions
Legal aid available through Mississippi Center for Legal Services
Check local rules for specific procedures

gulfport.name: Gulfport/Harrison County Notes
notes: Municipal Court may handle some cases
